AdmissionRequirements: Bachelor’s degree: Swiss Maturity Certificate (Maturität, Matura) or a Swiss Professional Maturity Certificate (Maturité professionnelle) with “Passerelle” or a Swiss Specialised Maturity Certificate (Maturité spécialisée) recognised throughout Switzerland with “Passerelle” or, in the case of foreign candidates, an upper secondary school-leaving certificate considered equivalent; evidence of sufficient English language proficiency
Candidates that have completed a Swiss Professional or Specialised Maturity need to undergo a complementary examination in order to be eligible for admission into the Bachelor program

Master’s degrees:  A Bachelor's degree from a university or other higher education institution or an equivalent foreign higher education institution recognised or accredited in the country of origin; evidence of sufficient English language proficiency
Students who wish to pursue a dual degree with our educational partner Tiffin University (TU) are subjected to the specific TU admission requirements

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1893 as Ecole hôtelière de Lausanne (Lausanne Hotel School). Acquired current title 2022
Created 1973.

Created in 2000. Geneva Business School provides Swiss-quality business education in Geneva, Barcelona, and Madrid, offering bachelor’s, master’s, MBA, and diverse continued education options that are 100% in English, and is committed to using innovative learning methods and new technologies to fully prepare students for the tools and environment of the professional marketplace. 
In the beginning, the focus was on providing training and professional development for bankers in Switzerland.
In the early 2000s, the school developed new iterations of its offering and public persona, up until 2009 when the name Geneva Business School was made official. A focus on quality quickly led to a number of international accreditations to offer recognized degrees to its students. Over the course of the next decade, the structure of the school evolved to include undergraduate students, rising to meet the demands of a global business environment.
Today Geneva Business School hosts a diverse student community and faculty with over 80 nationalities across our campuses, and a proud alumni network growing with each graduation.
AdmissionRequirements: International Baccalaureate with minimum 28 points; A-Levels; High school diploma or equivalent
TOEFL IBT: > 67 (or equivalent), IELTS
5 (or equivalent), or evidence of having studied in an English speaking environment for 3 years or more
Personal interview

The roots of the Swiss School of Management go back to 1981, as the Newport Graduate School was founded in the Canton of St. Gallen in Switzerland. In the year 2000 the school changed to its current name, Swiss School of Management. In order to facilitate international students to freely move in search for jobs to other European countries, the school decided to move its campus to Rome, Italy. Meanwhile, SSM has reopened its headquarter in the beautiful city of Bellinzona back in Switzerland. The high demand of students coming from other countries, who couldn't afford the very expensive living costs and tuition fees in Switzerland, motivated the school to open new learning centers in Dubai, Bahrian, Brescia and Cairo. Tuday the school counts over 5,000 students from all over the world.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: SSM has a continous open enrollment at the beginning of each month.
AdmissionRequirements: Bachelor's degree or relevant undergraduate degree
All candidates must have a sound command of the English language, both spoken and written
Minimum English proficiency level of 86 points on TOEFL or 7 bands on IELTS for all non-mother tongue applicants
Students with no TOEFL or IELTS certification can provide results from a language school or complete an English evaluation test from a local provider
